Agent & Developer Guidelines - epidscan

Source: AGENT_GUIDELINES.md

This file outlines the standard workflow and development practices for the epidscan project.

1. Git Workflow (Personal Project Mode)

This project follows a Local Feature -> Push Dev workflow to minimize remote noise.

  • Branches:
    • main: Stable release code. Pushed to remote.
    • dev: Integration branch. Pushed to remote.
    • feat/* or fix/*: Local only. Do NOT push these to remote unless for backup.
  • Process:

    1. Create a feature branch locally: git checkout -b feat/my-feature dev.

    2. Develop and Commit locally.

    3. Merge into dev:

      git checkout dev
git merge feat/my-feature

    4. Delete the feature branch: git branch -d feat/my-feature.

    5. Push only dev: git push origin dev.

2. R Package Development

We use standard R package tools.

  • Testing:

    • Always write unit tests for new functions in tests/testthat/.

    • Run full test suite before merging:

      devtools::test()

    • Check for regressions!

  • Documentation:

    • Use ROxygen2 comments (#') above functions.

    • Update documentation files:

      devtools::document()

    • Always commit generated man/*.Rd and NAMESPACE files.

  • Check:
    • Periodically run devtools::check() to ensure package integrity.

3. Style & Conventions

  • Code Style: Tidyverse style guide (snake_case for functions/vars).
  • Dependencies: Explicitly import using package::function() or @importFrom. Avoid @import package for whole packages.
